org.mundo.net.transport.ip
Interface IIPTransportConnection

All Superinterfaces:
ITransportConnection
All Known Implementing Classes:
TCPTransportConnection, UDPTransportConnection
public interface IIPTransportConnection
extends ITransportConnection

IP-based transport connections implement this interface. A transport connection is a point-to-point link to an adjacent node. Transport connections are opened and managed by transport services.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
IPTransportService

getRemotePort

int getRemotePort()
Returns the remote port number.

Returns:
the remote port number.

disconnectWait

boolean disconnectWait()
Waits until all messages in the send queue have been sent and closes the socket.

Returns:
true if it was a clean shutdown, or false otherwise.

init

void init(GUID nodeId,
          java.net.InetAddress addr,
          int port,
          TypedMap opts)
Called by the service during connection setup to provide information about the peer. Issues with this method: - nodeId should be stored in the route, not in the connection. - addr and port are sometimes initialized through constructors and sometimes via this method. There should only be one way to do it. - Many options are written to the route object by code in the connection implementation. This is pointless. The service should directly write these options to the route.

Parameters:
nodeId - node ID of the peer
addr - remote internet address
port - remote port number
opts - a map containing optional information

getState

int getState()
Returns the state of this connection.

Returns:
the state of this connection.
